alert.note: Alert for Eastern Cherry; Hooker; Logan; McPherson; Thomas; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 10:09PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Cherry, Hooker, northwestern Logan, northern McPherson, western Blaine and Thomas Counties through 1100 PM CDT/1000 PM MDT/... At 1008 PM CDT/908 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles south of Brownlee to 13 miles southeast of Whitman. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mullen, Thedford, Halsey, Seneca, Highway 83 crossing The Dismal River, Big Lamunyon Flats, East Cody Lake, Norway, Highway 97 crossing the Dismal River, Natwick, Schnick Lake, Kelso and Shimmons Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 181 and 227. Highway 92 between mile markers 188 and 195. Highway 97 between mile markers 35 and 69. Highway 83 between mile markers 132 and 168. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Cherry; Hooker; Logan; McPherson; Thomas; Western Cherry
